summary: This is an internal FBI email chain from September 2019 discussing victim compensation for Epstein victims. It involves FBI Victim Services Division and the Office of Victim Services (OVS) coordinating on whether victims can apply for compensation given delayed disclosures, and references anger over 'what happened over the weekend' (likely Epstein's death).

events.title: Epstein's death over the weekend
events.description: Reference to anger over 'what happened over the weekend' in an email dated Aug 12, 2019, which corresponds to Jeffrey Epstein's death in his jail cell on August 10, 2019.

keyFacts: Internal FBI email chain discusses victim compensation for Epstein victims.
FBI Victim Services Division is coordinating with the Office of Victim Services (OVS) regarding applications.
Reference is made to victims in the NYC area who disclosed abuse 'years ago' but only recently came forward.
The email from August 12, 2019, expresses anger over 'what happened over the weekend,' alluding to Epstein's death.
The correspondence seeks a letter from a DA or AUSA confirming they would have prosecuted if the case had been brought timely, to enable victim compensation.
